tn.text: "It is better to be a poor person"
This is an idiom. Here walking refers to living. AT: "who lives in his integrity" or "who lives an honest life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The word "speech" may be expressed as a verb. AT: "speaks perversely" or "speaks in an evil way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This refers to people trying to do something without the knowledge for how to correctly do it. AT: "to work hard without knowing what you are doing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the one who runs too fast misses the path
tn.text: This speaks of a person doing something too quickly and making mistakes as if running too quickly and missing the path. AT: "the one who acts too quickly makes mistakes" or "the one who acts too quickly makes poor choices" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here a person is referred to by his "heart" to emphasize his emotions. AT: "he rages" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

This means that a person who is wealthy will have many friends because wealth attracts people. The full meaning of this can be made clear. AT: "Those who are wealthy easily find many friends" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: a poor person is separated from his friends
tn.text: A poor person is separated from many of his friends because of his poverty. The meaning of this can be made explicit. AT: "poverty causes a person to lose his friends" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: A false witness will not go unpunished
tn.text: This can be written in positive and active form. AT: "They will certainly punish a false witness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he who breathes out lies will not escape
tn.text: This means that he will be captured. AT: "they will capture the one who breathes out lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

This is an idiom. Here "breathes" refers to lying constantly. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:06:17|6:19]]. AT: "constantly lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
someone who often gives away things
This is a slight exaggeration. AT: "it seems that everyone is a friend" or "almost everyone is a friend" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: how much more do his friends who go far away from him!
tn.text: This phrase is an exclamation to show that this is more likely than the previous phrase. AT: "therefore his friends will certainly hate him and go far away from him!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here the person is referred to by his "life" to emphasize himself being alive. AT: "loves himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"has understanding"

tn.ref: A false witness will not go unpunished
tn.text: This can be written in positive and active form. Translate this phrase the same as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:19:05|19:5]]. AT: "They will certainly punish a false witness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This figure of speech uses "breathes" to refer to lying constantly. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:06:17|6:19]]. AT: "constantly lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"It is not right"
condition of wealth and pleasure
The missing words may be added. AT: "it is much less fitting for a slave" or "it is even worse for a slave" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: Discretion makes a person slow to anger
tn.text: "A person who has discretion is slow to become angry"
This means to know what should be done in a particular situation. Translate this word the same as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:01:04|1:4]].

tn.ref: it is his glory to overlook
tn.text: "it will bring him glory to overlook" or "others will consider it honorable if he overlooks"
to forget on purpose

tn.ref: The wrath of the king is like the roaring of a young lion
tn.text: Here the lion's roaring refers to attacking. The wrath of a king is compared to the unpredictable and dangerous attack of a young lion. AT: "The wrath of the king is as dangerous as the attack of a young lion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: but his favor is like dew on the grass
tn.text: The favor of the king is compared to the refreshing water that appears on grass in the morning. AT: "but his favor is refreshing like dew on grass" or "but his favor is refreshing like the dew on the ground in the morning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"will ruin a father" (UDB)

tn.ref: a quarreling wife is a constant dripping of water
tn.text: This speaks of an annoying wife as if she were the constant dripping of water. AT: "a quarreling wife is as annoying and distracting as a constant dripping of water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"an arguing wife" or "a disagreeing wife"

tn.ref: A house and wealth are inherited from parents
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Children inherit a house and wealth from their parents" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate this word the same as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:12:23|12:23]].

tn.ref: a prudent wife is from Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh gives a prudent wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Laziness throws a person into a deep sleep
tn.text: This speaks of how laziness causes a person to sleep a lot as if laziness forcefully throws the person into sleep. AT: "Laziness makes a person sleep a lot" or "A lazy person sleeps a lot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This is an idiom which means to not eat. AT: "not eat" or "be hungry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"the command that he was taught" (UDB)
"protects his life"
This is an idiom which refers to how he lives. AT: "the way that he lives" or "how he lives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Whoever is kind to the poor lends to Yahweh
tn.text: Yahweh considers kindness shown to the poor to be kindness shown to him. One of the ways people are kind to the poor is by giving. AT: "The person who gives to the poor is giving to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to poor people. AT: "those who are poor" or "poor people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

This refers to while the child is young and will still accept discipline and instruction. The full meaning of this can be made clear. AT: "while he is young" or "while he can still be taught" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: and do not set your desire on putting him to death
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) this phrase describes punishing your child. AT: "but do not punish him so severely that he might die" or 2) this phrase describes what it is like if you do not punish your child. AT: "for if you do not punish him you are helping him destroy himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: set your desire on putting him
tn.text: This idiom means to be determined to cause something to happen. AT: "be determined to put him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tempered person** - This idiom refers to a person who is easily angered. AT: "A person who does not control his temper" or "A person who becomes angry quickly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This refers to the person bearing the consequences for what happens when he gets angry. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "must bear the consequences of his anger" or "must bear the consequences of what he does in his anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"if you save him." This refers to rescuing him when he has acted out of his anger. The meaning of this can be made explicit. AT: "if you rescue him after he has had an outburst" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"a 2nd time" or "again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: Listen to advice and accept instruction
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same and are repeated to emphasize how important it is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

This is an idiom. Here "listening" does not mean to merely listen, but to learn from the advice you are given and to follow it. AT: "Pay attention to advice" or "Follow advice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here the "heart" is used to refer to the "mind" to emphasize a person's desire. AT: "in a person's mind" or "that a person desires" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Yahweh's purpose" or "Yahweh's plans"
This idiom means to "happen." AT: "that will happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Honor for Yahweh leads people to life; anyone who has it will be satisfied
tn.text: This means that they will live a long time if they honor Yahweh. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "Those who honor Yahweh will live a long time; anyone who honors Yahweh will be satisfied" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here the word "it" refers to "honor for Yahweh."

tn.ref: satisfied and not afflicted by harm
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "satisfied; nothing will harm him" or "satisfied; he will be safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate this word the same as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:10:26|10:26]].

tn.ref: buries his hand in the dish
tn.text: "dips his hand in the dish" or "puts his hand in his plate." In the Biblical culture people usually ate with their hands as people do in many cultures today.

tn.ref: he will not even bring it back up to his mouth
tn.text: He does not bring his hand back to his mouth because he is too lazy. AT: "but he is too lazy to bring his hand up to his mouth to feed himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Strike a mocker, and the naive person
tn.text: "If you strike a mocker, the naive person"
"Punish"
"inexperienced person" or "immature person"
Translate this word the same as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:12:23|12:23]].

tn.ref: discipline one who is discerning, and
tn.text: "if you discipline one who is discerning,"
Here the abstract idea of knowledge is spoken of as if it were something that one could have more of. AT: "he will know more" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Possible meanings are 1) he brings it to himself. AT: "brings shame and reproach to himself" or 2) he brings it to his family. AT: "brings shame and reproach to his family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: If you cease to hear instruction
tn.text: Here "listening and obeying" is spoken of as if it were "hearing." AT: "If you stop paying attention to instruction" or "If you stop obeying instruction" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"you will abandon" or "you will turn your back on"
"knowledge"

tn.ref: the mouth of the wicked swallows iniquity
tn.text: This speaks of how wicked people enjoy doing evil by saying that they swallow iniquity as easily as they swallow food. AT: "the wicked enjoy doing evil as much as they enjoy eating food" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the mouth of the wicked swallows
tn.text: Here wicked people are referred to by their "mouths." AT: "the wicked swallow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This refers to wicked people. AT: "the wicked person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: Condemnation is ready for mockers and flogging for
tn.text: The words "condemnation" and "flogging" may be expressed as verbs. AT: "Yahweh is ready to condemn mockers and to flog" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The missing words may be added. AT: "flogging is ready for the backs" or "he is ready to flog the backs" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
beating with a whip or stick
